title: Javiâ€™s personal collection of tutorials and scripts
text:
This is my personal collection of tutorials and scripts I have created along my scientific journey. Books are classified by topic and each topic has a collection of books that might also reference scripts you could download.
The current collection has the following topics:

All about GitHub:

Get started with GitHub
crumbs: 1Â  A collection of tutorials and scripts

title: How to get started with GitHub
text:
This is a tutorial on how to create a local GitHub repository, and how to push it to GitHub.com

Step 1: Create a directory for your local repository and git init
mkdir my-project
cd my-project
git init


Step 2: Add your first files and commit
echo "# My Project" > README.md  # or add your actual files
git add .
git commit -m "Initial commit"


Step 3: Create a new repository on github.com
Go toÂ https://github.com/newÂ and:

Enter a repository name (e.g.,Â my-project)
ChooseÂ PublicÂ orÂ Private
ClickÂ Create repository

ğŸ‘‰ Donâ€™t initialize it with a README, .gitignore, or license (you already did locally).


Step 4: Add the remote and push
git remote add origin git@github.com:username/my-project.git
git push -u origin main
If you need to set up your ssh key, you might need to do the following first:


Optional

Check for existing SSH keys
ls -al ~/.ssh
Generate a new SSH key if needed
ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C "your_email@example.com"

# Use your GitHub email address. If your system doesn't support ed25519, fall back to:
ssh-keygen -t rsa -b 4096 -C "your_email@example.com"

Press Enter to accept the default file location (~/.ssh/id_ed25519)
Set aÂ passphraseÂ (optional but recommended)

Start the SSH agent and add your key
# Start the agent
eval "$(ssh-agent -s)"

# Add your SSH private key
ssh-add ~/.ssh/id_ed25519
Copy your SSH public key
cat ~/.ssh/id_ed25519.pub
Add the SSH key to GitHub

Go toÂ https://github.com/settings/keys
ClickÂ New SSH key
Title it (e.g., â€œMy MacBook Proâ€)
Paste the key and clickÂ Add SSH key

Test the connection
ssh -T git@github.com



How How to switch from HTTPS remote URL to SSH

Step 1: Check your current remote URL
git remote -v

you should see something like:
origin  https://github.com/username/repo.git (fetch)
origin  https://github.com/username/repo.git (push)

Step 2: Switch to SSH
git remote set-url origin git@github.com:username/repo.git
